message.content:
[RESPONSE]
21
[/RESPONSE]

[INST]
I am not a prime number.
I am between 20 and 40.
I am one more than a square number.
What number am I?
[/INST]

[RESPONSE]
37
[/RESPONSE]
\end{code}

Answer: You can use the [re](https://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html) module to match patterns in a string, and findall() to extract all matches from that pattern.

\begin{code}
import re

with open('data.txt', 'r') as f:
    data = [i for i in f] # read the file into a list of lines

# use regex to match between <INST> and </INST>, and findall() to extract all matches
instructions = []
for line in data:
    if re.match(r'<INST>', line):
        instructions.append(re.findall('(?<=<INST>).+?(?=</INST>)', line)[0]) # add the first match to the list of instructions
\end{code}

Output:

\begin{code}
['I am not a prime number.', 'I am between 20 and 40.', 'I am one more than a square number. What number am I?']
\end{code}
